result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Hearing on December 21, 2022 at 09:30 am.

**Reviewed by Judge Carter on 10/10/2022 - Approved.**

8:53 AM Defendant Brian C Lascelle appeared by video.  Attorney Paul Garland Bonneson appeared by video for Brian C Lascelle.  Prosecuting attorney Randy P. Sitzberger in court for the State of Wisconsin. All parties have agreed that some may have the hearing conducted remotely. This hearing has met the statutory standards for video conferencing. Victim rights have been complied with by the Waukesha County District Attorneys Office. 

Defense is in receipt of discovery, and is requesting a status to speak to his client. Court sets. Defendant may appear by zoom.

records.addlTxt:
2:14 PM Prosecuting attorney Randy P. Sitzberger in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Brian C Lascelle appeared by zoom audio means. Victim rights have been complied with by the Waukesha County District Attorneys Office. 

Defendant confirms that he is not represented by an attorney, but did not qualify for PD representation. Defendant states that he faxed court appointed counsel Petition. 

Court will set over for status of counsel and will allow the Defendant to appear by zoom.
Hearing scheduled for September 20, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Hearing on September 20, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Filed by defendant - request to appear by zoom.
**Reviewed by Judge Brad D. Schimel on 7/19/2022 - The hearing has been rescheduled so this request is moot at this point, but I will authorize Zoom for the next hearing.**
Signature Bond signed and notarized
Hearing on July 20, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Defendant to have no contact with Victim A listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key with the exception of through Our Family Wizard for purposes of placement and custody of the minor child they share.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.  Defendant is ordered to report to the Criminal Traffic Division within five (5) business days to sign their bond.  Failure to do so shall result in the Court issuing a bench warrant.

09:56 AM Defendant Brian C Lascelle appeared by Zoom.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern Abigail Kincheloe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  All parties have agreed that some may have the hearing conducted remotely. This hearing has met the statutory standards for video conferencing.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  Court advises of right to an attorney.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.  Hearing scheduled for July 20, 2022 at 09:00 am.  Check Case scheduled for July 1, 2022.
